abstract: Lawyer for arms expert and former State Dept contractor Stephen J Kim writes letter to Justice Dept criticizing plea deal given to retired Gen David H Petraeus, who will not serve prison time even though he gave military secrets to mistress; says deal shows double standard on prosecution of leaked classified information, as Kim is serving 13-month sentence for disclosing such information to Fox News.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer for an imprisoned government contractor who revealed classified information has criticized the plea deal given to retired Gen. David H. Petraeus, who gave military secrets to his mistress.

headline.main: Letter Calls Plea Deal for David Petraeus a ‘Profound Double Standard’
headline.print_headline: Letter Calls Plea Deal for Retired General Petraeus a ‘Profound Double Standard’

snippet: A lawyer for an imprisoned government contractor who revealed classified information has criticized the plea deal given to retired Gen. David H. Petraeus, who gave military secrets to his mistress.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
